definition: snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean

sentences.english: Enjoy a free $25 cash voucher with a purchase of two quarts of ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 惠顧兩磅裝雪糕兩筒，可免費獲贈$25現金券一張。

sentences.english: We have ice-cream and chocolate cakes today.
sentences.chinese: 我們今天有雪糕和朱古力蛋糕。

sentences.english: Use a popsicle to mix up a cup of hot coffee.
sentences.chinese: 拿一支雪糕把一杯剛衝的咖啡攪勻。

sentences.english: Well, I think that shirt makes you look like you should work at a Baskin-Robbins.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得你穿這件襯衣像雪糕餐廳的服務員。

sentences.english: We have ice cream and apple pie, would you like some?
sentences.chinese: 我們提供雪糕和蘋果批，你們要些嗎？

sentences.english: Hippo immediately went to "Xuegao" and angrily accused him of stealing the painting.
sentences.chinese: 河馬立刻找到了“雪糕”，氣呼呼的指責他偷了畫。

sentences.english: Fill the cone with ice cream, and then a scoop on top.
sentences.chinese: 然後往蛋筒裏裝滿雪糕並插上一根棒子。

sentences.english: It's perverse of him to buy hot dogs when we want ice-cream.
sentences.chinese: 我們要雪糕，他偏買熱狗，這個人脾氣乖張。

sentences.english: Do you agree that Appolo is a world class retailer with unique store image?
sentences.chinese: 你同意“阿波羅”是獨一無二的雪糕零售商嗎？
在雙勝喫雪糕休息一下。

sentences.english: In Alabama it's illegal to have an ice cream cone in your back pocket at all times.
sentences.chinese: 在阿拉巴馬州，把一筒雪糕放在褲後袋是犯法的。

sentences.english: He's gone for ice-creams and a stroll. He doesn't like the beach.
sentences.chinese: 他去買雪糕順便散散步，他並不喜歡呆在海灘。

sentences.english: One more ice-cream vendor in Tverskaya Street.
sentences.chinese: 多一個雪糕在特維爾大街的供應商。

sentences.english: The ice cream, can always take away ice crisp cool enjoyment to the people.
sentences.chinese: 雪糕，總能給人們帶去冰爽清涼的享受。

sentences.english: They can also make cool and refreshing ice cream, popsicles and red bean soup.
sentences.chinese: 每逢盛夏，可用紅小豆製成雪糕，冰棒，冰淇淋。

sentences.english: Please bring us one vanilla ice cream and two pineapple sundaes .
sentences.chinese: 請來一個香草雪糕，兩個菠蘿聖代。

definition: sugar-coated Chinese hawthorn or other fruit on a stick/tanghulu
shaved or crushed ice dessert or beverage
tanghulu/candied fruits on bamboo skewers dipped in sugar syrup, a common Chinese snack
